newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Malaysia's Rimbunan eyes Estonian timber firm.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia's Rimbunan eyes Estonian timber firm.

text.p: Malaysia's largest timber company Rimbunan Hijau is considering the purchase of a majority stake in Estonian wood processor Repo Factories, newspaper Aripaev quoted the company as saying.
It quoted Repo chairman Rein Kuusik as saying that Rimbunan, owned by Malaysian tycoon Tiong Hiew King, wanted to buy the stake but the Estonian firm was considering a joint venture.
A price for the share purchase was not given.
Repo was not available to confirm the report, which said the Estonian company needed 290 million kroons to buy new machines for making wood planks.
Repo's turnover reached 211.6 million kroons in the first 10 months of the year and it expects it to be 260 million kroons for the full year.
Timber is the core business of Rimbunan but it also operates in the fields of shipping, insurance, cocoa and travel.
